Title: OpenOffice: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in OpenOffice Impress could cause memory
    corruption.

Background.Text: Apache OpenOffice is an open-source office software suite for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, graphics, databases and more.

Description.Text: An exploitable out-of-bounds vulnerability exists in OpenOffice Impress when handling MetaActions.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted OpenDocument Presentation .ODP or Presentation Template .OTP file using OpenOffice Impress, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenOffice users should upgrade to the latest version:
